derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from condole, influenced by French condoléance

entry.def: A message of condolence is a message in which you express your sympathy for someone because one of their friends or relatives has died recently.

example.ex: Neil sent him a letter of condolence.
example.tran: 尼尔给他发了一封唁函。

entry.def: When you offer or express your condolences to someone, you express your sympathy for them because one of their friends or relatives has died recently.

example.ex: He expressed his condolences to the families of the people who died in the incident.
example.tran: 他向这次事件中的死者家属表示了慰唁。

means.word_mean: 1. an expression of sympathy with another's grief;

sentences.en: We would like to take this opportunity to convey our heartfelt condolences to the families of the victims.
